plan.system: You are a concise senior engineer. Return precise, directly usable output.

output_preview:
<think>
Hmm, the user is asking about the year the United States declared independence. They want a concise response in bullet points as a senior engineer would provide. 

This is a straightforward historical fact - the United States declared independence on July 4, 1776 with the signing of the Declaration of Independence. The user specifically wants just the year, not the full date. 

I recall that while the Continental Congress approved it on July 4, 1776, the actual declaration was formalized later that year. But for most historical purposes, 1776 is universally accepted as the year of independence declaration. 

The user emphasized "precise, directly usable output" and "concise senior engineer" style. So I shouldn't overcomplicate it - just give the year in bullet points as requested. No extra explanations since they want direct output. 

Also noting they said "respond in bullet points" - so I'll format it as a single bullet point containing just the year. Keeping it minimal per their constraints. 

*checks historical accuracy* Yes, definitely 1776. No controversy here. Will respond with: • 1776
</think>

• 1776
